chapter.title: User Preferences
chapter.para: For each installation of PMB, you must specify a username and password. This allows PMB to identify you, and thus to know the user rights that you have within the application (circulation, cataloging, administration...). This username / password combination allows PMB to store a certain number of parameters which enable you to have a personalised layout or your own colour scheme.

In summary, the user preferences are a collection of stored parameters for each user. These preferences are therefore linked to the user name entered on the login screen. To view your preferences, click on the link pref. at the top right of the screen, next to logout.

sect1.title: Password , language, style
sect1.para: Here you can change your password. If you enter a New password, please re-enter it in the Confirmation field.
You can also select another Language. Warning, certain languages require a particular style for the most optimal display.
You can also change the style of your display : Style/theme.

sect1.title: Number of records per page
sect1.para: The Number of records displayed on each page is personalisable for the following screens:

The higher this number, the more results will be returned per page,thus the longer the page will be. If you prefer short pages, you can reduce these values; if you prefer to display the maximum number of records on a single page, you can increase them.
The default choice corresponds to the choices of the developers and a system display resolution of 1024x768.

sect1.title: Application functionality parameters
sect1.para: Automatic popup of loan ticket: automatically display the loan ticket at the time of validating a new loan.
Play audible alerts: audible signal sounded when an error message is displayed.

sect1.title: I have read and accepted the terms of the PMB user licence
sect1.para: With PMB version 1.3 there is a new licence: the CECILL licence. This licence is compatible with the GNU/GPL. For more information, see http://www.cecill.info
This new licence is displayed during the installation of PMB, and after you are connected and entered your username and password.
To not display the licence at login, select No longer display the licence at login.

sect1.title: Default application values
sect1.para: This part of the screen allows the specification of a number of default values for the creation of a copy:
This allows you to save time when cataloguing.
You can also specify the default values for the creation of new notices:

listitem.para: language. By default fixed to fre, for French. The language codes are defined by the UNIMARC standard. You must consult the list of languages and their codes by opening, in a text editor, the file pmb/includes/marc_tables/en_UK/lang.xml

Author function. By default fixed to 70 for author. The function of an author can vary according to the work concerned: director for a video cassette of a theatre piece, photographer for a collection, author for a book, ... The functions of the authors are defined by the UNIMARC standard. You must consult the list of author functions and their codes by opening, in a text editor, the file pmb/includes/marc_tables/en_UK/function.xml
